reviews.review: Been a big marvel fan since I saw the first Iron Man.  Seen every movie several times.  This one is the best of all.  Brings it all together with an rollercoaster ride that will leave you in awe and in tears.  thanos is by far the most evil twisted villain in the marvel universe.  Go see this movie and enjoy the ride.
I love it. It's a different to classical Disney's movie.
The series have given a collection of most heroes in this battle. It is wonderful and gives a feeling of emotion, agony and sadness. It is a must to watch among Marvel Fans.
No pudo haber mejor adaptacion que esta!
I was ABOUT TO GIVE THIS A WOW, WOW, WOW, THEN THE LAST 1/3 WAS TOTALY DISAPPOINTING. wHY DID THEY RUINA  TERRIFIC PREMISE WITH STUPID CAMPY JOKES.
The movie was a cumulative of all the other movies in the MCU and overall it was AWESOME.

superb movie                                                                                                                                                next level  excitement, fun, thrill, action, emotions, sadness 
Perfectly balanced like whole universe should be

As part of the Thursday release crowd, this will be Marvel's new #1 box office blockbuster! It's apparent there are some real cretin's out there 'professionally' reviewing movies. We should let Thanos at them. Marvel did the near impossible merging the MCU story lines into one easy to follow entertainment bonanza! Action, humor, surprises!   No matter who your favorite Marvel hero is (Starlord and Cap, then Tony), you won't be disappointed immearsing yourself in this 2 1/2 hour adventure... everyone gets relevant screen time. No spoilers here. BUT, can't wait for the Summer finale! 10 stars+++!

One of the finest movies ever created, forgetting the subject matter, this isn't on the same level as say Schindler's List or Citizen Kane, the effort and skill it took to create this masterpiece is nothing short of heroic. 

I went into this film expecting to be disappointed, after having built it up in my head for so long, I kept saying that even if it sucked, it wouldn't suck because I am such a crossover nut. Seeing Tony, Peter Quill, and Dr. Strange snapping wisecracks at one another was bound to make me squeal like a little girl, and it didn't disappoint.

At first I started finding little faults trying to find a reason to dislike the film, but I just couldn't. The initial interaction between Thor and the Guardians saw to that.

It was stellar, and even that word doesn't do it justice. Every character had moments, characters I thought would make the most difference didn't, and most of those I expected to matter very little, mattered the most. Even Groot had one of the best moments in the movie. 

Thanos had depth, his henchman had personality, his motives were sadistic and also messianic all at the same time. Some so called critics called the ending cheap, I called it brilliant, because it gave so much depth and meaning to those that had fallen before. Those that fell before the end should stay that way, but one in particular they are going to have a problem with. The character is to important to the group.

Had I not had to work the next morning I would have got back in line, even though it stretched from the Imax door back to the theater lobby. 

To sum it up, how much do you want for that arm?
